0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Disorder of pituitary gland; Diagnosis: 200 to 500 mcg IV
  • Disorder of thyroid gland; Diagnosis: 500 mcg (range 200 to 500 mcg) IV

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Disorder of thyroid gland; Diagnosis: (6 to 16 y of age) 7 mcg/kg IV; MAX dose: 500 mcg
  • Disorder of thyroid gland; Diagnosis: (up to 6 y of age) 7 mcg/kg IV have been used, however, experience in this age group is limited

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Disorder of pituitary gland; Diagnosis
  • Disorder of thyroid gland; Diagnosis

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• adrenocortical drugs; it is not recommended to withdraw maintenance doses used in the therapy of known hypopituitarism
  • chronic administration of levodopa has been reported to inhibit the TSH response to protirelin
  • thyroid hormones reduce the TSH response to protirelin
  • transient changes in blood pressure frequently occur immediately following administration; do not administer to patients in whom marked, rapid changes in blood pressure would be dangerous unless the potential benefit clearly outweighs the potential risk

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Hypertension, Hypotension, Lightheadedness
  • Dermatologic:Flushing
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal discomfort, Bad taste in mouth, Nausea, Xerostomia
  • Neurologic:Headache
  • Renal:Urgent desire to urinate
Serious
  • Neurologic:Seizure, In patients with predisposing conditions (rare)
  • Ophthalmic:Amaurosis, In patients with pituitary tumors

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono:
• Systemic: Diagnostic aid (thyroid function)-Like naturally occurring thyrotropin-releasing hormone (TRH), protirelin stimulates release of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) from the anterior pituitary. As a result, protirelin can be used to detect an increase in or blunting of TSH response due to a variety of medical conditions or to confirm adequate suppression of TSH response by administration of thyroid hormones.
  • Protirelin appears to increase plasma growth hormone concentrations in some acromegalic patients. It also increases serum prolactin concentrations.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: monitor blood pressure before drug is administered and at frequent intervals during the first 15 minutes after injection

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Instruct patient to rise slowly from a sitting/supine position, especially within 15 min after drug administration, as drug may cause transient changes in blood pressure.
  • This drug may cause light-headedness, flushing, abdominal discomfort, bad taste in mouth, nausea, xerostomia, headache, or urgent desire to urinate.
